body.p: Memphis, Tennessee, attorney and Governor of Tennessee. Franklin County, Tennessee, native. Son of Isham Harris and Lucy Davidson Harris. Attended Winchester Academy in Winchester, Tennessee. Married Martha Mariah Travis Harris in 1843. Father of Eugene Harris, James Harris, Edwin Harris, Charles Harris, and Isham Harris. Clerk in Paris, Tennessee, in 1832. Merchant in Ripley, Mississippi. Attorney in Paris in 1841. Elected to the Tennessee State Senate in 1847. Elected to the House of Representatives of the United States in 1848 and 1850. Elected Governor of Tennessee in 1857, 1859, and 1861. Memphis resident in 1860. Owned five enslaved people in Memphis in 1860.
